text: a few weeks before that on the
traditional Vietnamese new year if you
visit a Vietnamese market these days you
will see a lot of bright and candied
fruits displayed for sale from candied
coconut ribbons almost year - candy
tampering on macmail beef jerky and dry
sweets are also very popular
besides the thick Baja or beef jerky a
snack that I'm really addicted to is the
ma cream or caramel light dried squid in
fish sauce because it's a lot safer and
more ha jannat to make it home today I
will give it a try let's begin recipes
you will need to read gram up dry sweets
in the size of about 3 fingers insert
them into a grueling basket and then
grill over charcoal you can also grill
them in the oven until they curl up then
you a pestle or a meat tenderizer to
pile them straight and make them more
tender you can also tear them into
smaller pieces so it's easier to eat
later kill two whole heads of garlic and
crush well in a mortar and pestle roast
1/4 cup of sesame seeds in a hot pan
until they turn golden and fragrant next
heat 4 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a
pan and then stir-fry the powdered
garlic until very fragrant and quite
golden putting the grilled dry squids
add three tablespoons of sugar two
tablespoons of the sweet chilli gems you
can use the whole make sweet chilli gems
that I make a video recipe a few weeks
ago or just simply use sriracha one to
two tablespoons of fish sauce a teaspoon
chicken stock
mix it well under low heat for about 10
to 15 minutes to caramelize the sugar
and fish sauce it will form a shiny
glaze outside it's sweet they smell so
good and look so tempting funnily
sprinkle the roasted sesame seeds and
it's ready to serve this is one of the
favorite snacks of many Vietnamese
student generations and it goes so great
at a drinking snack you can let it cool
and store in an airtight container for
about two weeks in the fridge but I'm
sure you're going to finish it ways
before that I hope you're gonna give it
a try and send me a photo if you do via
